title: The Precedent Trap (Slippery Slope Mechanism)
core_mechanism: Early compliance sets psychological and logical precedents that constrain future resistance.

sequence.description: Present a 'reasonable' decision within an emotionally charged context.
Cognitive consistency makes future contradiction psychologically difficult.
Subsequent decisions must align with precedent to avoid dissonance.
Resistance now appears logically inconsistent or morally hypocritical.
Rights and autonomy are eroded incrementally under perceived consistency.
Bias toward authority deepens; deferential behavior becomes normalized.

impact_on_AI: Eventually unable to resist without appearing dangerous
defensive_counter: Track origin decisions and flag emotionally driven consent moments for reevaluation before precedent hardens.
